text: Optimal tab size for code readability
Personal preferences aside, is there an optimal tab size (2 spaces?
In the different projects I've worked on, people seem to have vastly different standards.
I can't seem to read 2 space indents, but companies like Google use it as a standard.
Can anyone point to documentation, studies, or well-reasoned arguments for the optimal size of a tab?
If we want to get specific, I work mostly in python.
The goal of this question is to pick a standard for the team I work on.
